derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from French pinace, probably based on Latin pinus 'pine' (see pine); compare with Italian pinaccia and Spanish pinaza

entry.def: A pinnace is a small boat carried on a large ship. Pinnaces are used to carry goods and people from the ship to the shore.

means.word_mean: 1. a boat for communication between ship and shore

auth_sentence.content: Built from oak and teak in 1905, Vere was originally a Naval Steam Pinnace before being sold as a cruiser in 1925.
